intro: Astragalus kentrophyta, commonly known as the broad-leaved milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Astragalus kentrophyta is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
